title: The $90 Billion Squeeze: What the Triad's Budget Really Means for Your Capture Strategy
description: Two massive funding streams converge at the exact moment the Pentagon is tearing up its acquisition rulebook. The $40.5 billion Defense Health Program budget sits alongside a brand-new $50 billion Rural Health Transformation Program.

title: The MHS Triad Part 2: The Capability Stack
description: The programs that prove the doctrine works, the telehealth landscape they're inheriting, and what it all means for contractors, beneficiaries, and the warfighter.

title: The MHS Triad Part 1: Meet the Three Leaders Reshaping Military Medicine
description: Keith Bass, Emil Michael, and Admiral Darin Via aren't operating in silos. They're an interlocking system about to transform how we think about military medicine.

title: Department of War: What the Name Change Really Means for Defense Health
description: The metric of success is no longer patient satisfaction scores. It's return-to-duty rates and survivability of the force.

title: The Audit Mandate: Why DoD's 2028 Deadline Changes Everything
description: DoD must achieve a clean audit opinion by December 31, 2028. That's not a goal. It's a congressional mandate. And Section 1002 gives it real teeth.

title: The Oura Disaster: What the Failed Wearables Contract Teaches Us
description: The $96M sole-source contract didn't die because WHOOP filed a protest. It died because DHA realized it couldn't audit the data.

title: Human Performance Optimization: The Army's H2F Program and What It Means for DHA
description: 35% fewer injuries. 37% fewer suicides. $3 million per brigade. The ROI math works. Now Via wants to scale it across the joint force.

title: GenAI.mil: What Emil Michael's AI Rollout Means for Defense Health
description: 3 million users, right now, at every classification level. Michael wants AI embedded in the daily battle rhythm of every warfighter.
